summary: This document is the Fourth Amendment to the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust, executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein. It details the removal of Ghislaine Maxwell and Ira Zicherman as successor co-Trustees and the appointment of Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and Lawrence Newman as their replacements.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the Grantor of the trust and executed the Fourth Amendment.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell was removed as a successor co-Trustee of the trust.

persons.name: Ira Zicherman
persons.context: Ira Zicherman was removed as a successor co-Trustee of the trust.

persons.context: Joseph Pagano was appointed as a successor co-Trustee of the trust.

persons.context: Lawrence Newman was appointed as a successor co-Trustee of the trust.

connections.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein had Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-Trustee of his trust before her removal.
Jeffrey E. Epstein had Ira Zicherman as a co-Trustee of his trust before his removal.
Darren K. Indyke was appointed as a successor co-Trustee of the trust by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Joseph Pagano was appointed as a successor co-Trustee of the trust by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Lawrence Newman was appointed as a successor co-Trustee of the trust by Jeffrey E. Epstein.

events.title: Fourth Amendment to the Trust
events.description: The Fourth Amendment to the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust was executed, removing certain co-Trustees and appointing new ones.

keyFacts: The document is a legal amendment to the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust.
Ghislaine Maxwell and Ira Zicherman were removed as successor co-Trustees.
Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and Lawrence Newman were appointed as successor co-Trustees.
The amendment was executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
The document was notarized by Uren J. Kwintner.
